text:
18 Leicestershire events you can enjoy over the next four days By Becky_Jones1 | Posted: June 14, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Leicester Racecourse is hosting the Racecourse Del Mar event on Saturday 18 Leicestershire events you can enjoy over the next four days X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Are you looking for something to do over the next few days? 
Well, there's a great variety of things happening in Leicestershire - just take a look at the events below and we reckon you'll find something to suit 
Thurs, June 15 
Antiques Roadshow - Abbey Pumping Station 
Here's your chance to have your family treasures appraised by experts from the BBC show. The event will be open from 9.30am and as long as you are in the main queue to the Roadshow's Reception Desk by 4.30pm, you will get to meet the team of specialists for the appraisal of your items. 
Thurs, June 15 - Sunday, June 18 
Beer Festival - Broood@VinQuatre, Leicester 
You'll be spoiled for choice, with 20 beers from the Lakes and Manchester. Breweries participating include Brack 'n' Brew, Fell Brewery and Hubsters. 
Thurs, June 15 
Anthony Cartwright: The Cut - Kibworth Library, part of Kibworth Book Festival 
The Black Country author will be talking about his new book from by Peirene Press, a commissioned novel responding to Brexit, published on the anniversary of the referendum. 7.30pm. £5 tickets include wine/juice. 
Thurs, June 15 
The Rock Society - Firebug, Leicester 
A weekly night of all things Rock and Metal. DJs from midnight until the early hours. Free Entry. 
Fri, June 16 
Hugh Fraser, aka Captain Hastings - Kibworth Cricket Club, part of Kibworth Book Festival 
Hugh will be talking about his acting career as Poirot's TV sidekick and his recently published crime novels. The books will be available to purchase on the night and Hugh will be signing and dedicating copies. 7.30pm. Tickets £5. 
Fri, June 16- Sun, June 25 
ArtBeat - Clarendon Park, Leicester 
ArtBeat features a series of cultural events including music, comedy, dance, film and children's activities that take place in various venues in Clarendon Park. For details of events, visit the website: www.clarendonpark.net 
Fri, June 16 
An audience with Ceri Dupree - The Y Theatre 
Internationally renowned female impersonator Ceri Dupree, for one night only, will be performing his brand new show. Begins 8pm. Tickets £15. 
Fri, June 16 
Psychic Supper - James Cafe Bistro, Leicester 
The evening includes a two course meal, after which a medium will join your table for your individual readings. Later on, diners will have a chance for a private reading. £17.95 per person. 
Sat, June 17 
Racecourse Del Mar - Leicester Racecourse 
This race day is throwing it back to the 80s and 90s, with live performances from British Reggae stars Aswad and Dance Anthems DJ Dave Pearce. You'll also be able to watch the horse racing and enjoy some street food. Gates open 4.10pm, first race 6.10pm. £20. Accompanied under 18s go free. 
Sat, June 17 
Wine tasting - Rothley Wine Ltd 
These events are run monthly on a Saturday by Thirst Media. The tour and tasting takes 90 minutes and you can choose to purchase a ticket for the 12pm, 1.30pm or 3pm slot. You'll get a tour of the vineyard and winery with Rothley Wine's vintner, Liz Robson, and will learn all about growing grapes and making wine in the heart of the English countryside, direct from the expert. After the tour, there's a guided tasting from local food and wine writer and director of Thirst Media, Laura Hadland. Tour and tasting tickets are £12.50. 
Sat, June 17 
BosFest 2017 - Market Bosworth Sports Club 
For 2017, the popular free live music event 'Pop in the Park' has been incorporated into a brand new event – 'BosFest'. From 11am to 4pm you can watch the best of local talent and entry is free. At 6.30pm, the venue becomes home to a ticketed concert headlined by David Bowie tribute act "The Bowie Experience". Tickets are available at Michaelmas House and the library for £17.50, £20 on the gate. Family £50 earlybird (2 adults + 2 children) £55 on the gate. For further Bosworth Festival events, visit the website: www.bosworthfestival.co.uk 
Sat, June 17 
Rick Wakeman - De Montfort Hall 
Currently celebrating his 50th year as a professional musician, keyboard player, songwriter and broadcaster, Rick Wakeman recently made chart history when his Piano Portraits album became the first solo piano album to enter the UK's Top 10. The show will include at least eight of the pieces on the album, plus other musical surprises, as well as anecdotes from this accomplished raconteur. Begins 7.30pm. Tickets £27.50, concessions £23.50. 
Sat, June 17 
Gig on the Gort Festival - The Emerald Centre, Leicester 
Celebrating 10 years of The Emerald Centre, this event will include live music, multicultural performances, food and a bar. 1pm-11pm. Free entry. 
Until Sat June 17 
Ladies in Lavender - The Little Theatre 
Based on the hit film screenplay by Charles Dance starring Judi Dench and Maggie Smith, and on the original short story by William J. Locke, Ladies In Lavender tells the tale of two sisters Ursula and Janet who live in a close-knit fishing village in picturesque Cornwall, in 1936. 7.30pm plus 2.30pm Saturday. Tickets £14.50, concessions £13. 
Sat, June 17 and Sun, June 18 
Wildlife Weekend - Bradgate Park 
A weekend of activities for adults and children introducing the park's varied wildlife. 10am - 4pm. Free event. 
Sat, June 17 - Sun, June 18 
Foxton Locks Festival - Foxton 
This event - now in its eighth year - promises fun for all the family including live music, historic re-enactments, dog shows, and children's activities. There's a craft marquee, marquee bar and food village. Plus, trading boats on the canal and locks will be dressed for the occasion, creating a scenic display for festival goers. The festival will run from 10am until midnight on June 17 and from 10am until 5pm on June 18. Admission: £7 adults (includes parking) children under 16 free if accompanied by an adult. 
Sat, June 17 - Sun, June 18 
New Walk Museum birthday celebrations - New Walk Museum and Art Gallery 
New Walk Museum turns 168 years old this year, so why not wish the museum a very happy birthday and take part in craft activities, lectures and more. 11am - 4pm. Free event. 
Sun, June 18 
The Sugarhill Gang, Grandmaster Melle Mel and Scorpio live - 2Funky Music Cafe, Leicester 
For the first time ever catch these musicians live in Leicester. 7pm- 11pm. Tickets £20.
